content:
Original:

Edited(added a new sentence):
If the score is below zero, it should be set to 0.
Added "write winner" to stub generator so that the initial default code shows the syntax for debugging and outputting the answer.

The contribution has been approved, so this is only my observation about tests and validators. They differ only by player names. If the solution has bug in score calculation and nevertheless passes all the tests, then it will also pass all the validators, regardless the player names.
In my opinion, Test/Validator 9 and Test/Validator 10 are inconsistent. For instance, in Test 9, Patricia wins after the 4th round, but Delphine plays only 3 rounds. :(

You may clarify the rules for missing:

Each time you miss the target, your total is decreased by 20 points.
If you miss twice consecutively, your total is decreased by another 10 points.
If you miss three times in the same round, your whole total is reset at 0.
In other words X.X means -40 but XX. and .XX means -50.
You should propose more tests for beginners, one test for each rule then tests that use more and more rules.

I would change the tags just to condition and can you highlight the consecutively by the missed shoots. It is easy to over read it.

For a beginner to condinggame, this could be a good task

somehow i think that this should be a fastest challenge , it will be better than a Classic Puzzle because it's verry easy and it might be fun to implement it faster than others , it's an opinion though xD
A round like `X 5 X` is never tested. (This round's score should be -35)

I like the puzzle. Need some clarifications though:

```
But, when you miss the target, your total is decreased by 20 points.
If you miss a second time in the same round, your total is decreased by 30 points.
If you miss three times in the same round, your total is reset at 0.
```

So when you have a consecutive misses, is the total decreased by 20, then its decreased by 30 next one? in the total of 50? or a total of 30 all together?

and for the 3rd statement, do you reset the whole total to 0 or only the ones that you have subtracted so far? -50 -> 0? or T (sum of all points) -> 0?

A fair amount of typos, "you total" seven times (instead of your total), "not increase" (instead of not increased), "least round" (instead of least rounds). 

Many other typo/grammar mistakes, could someone please fix them? Thanks.
Not everyone knows dart games. You should explain more basic rules, such as that there are three darts per round.

Now the translation is updated. you have a description of the rule : "Every player shoot 3 darts a round, unless you reach or exceed 101 points, in which case your round immediately ends.

When a dart hits the target you tentatively collect points. There are multiplier rings that increase the points of some darts."

Thanks a lot eveybody.
Someone help me for the translation. Thanks a lot !

Thanks for your help, now the description is updated.
I add "(20 points for the first time and 30 points for the second time)". and someone help me for the translation.

Hello,
You are right ! I updated the test "2 players and lot of shoots" and i added a sequence with "X 5 X".
Thanks RShields,

Hello, i know it's not difficult but it's look like at CREDIT CARD VERIFIER (LUHNâ€™S ALGORITHM). And I think it's too long for a fastest because you must to register too many variables for a fastest. But it's an opinion ;)

Hello Orleger,
I think now it's done. I updated the desciption.
Thanks

Hi nicola,
I added tests :
- 1 winner & 1 looser
- One missed
- Two missed
- Two missed consecutively
- Three missed consecutively
- Over the score
They test little by little the differents cases.
Thanks,

Hi Kirbiby,
Ok, i updated the description and i added "in the same round". It's important because if you do ..XX.. you decreased only -40 points because it's not in the same round.
Thanks,

Hello Stilgart,
I updated now Delphine play 4 rounds too.
In the 10, David won in the first round, other players continue to play for the other places but the winner is David.
Thanks

Hello,
You have right, let me a moment and i will change the test this Week end.
Thanks,

I've removed the sentence as explained in my message in the forum ( https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-the-dart-101/203063/6 ).

I've also formatted the words "the rules have changed" in bold to highlight the fact and convince the players not to try to apply the usual scoring rules when solving the puzzle.

By the way, I've taken the opportunity to revise the description of Line 1 in the Input section:

original
Line1 : A number N of player

revised
Line 1 : An integer N for the number of players
Thanks.

Loser, not looser. ;-)
I also added what happens if you exceed 101 (ie stop playing).
My previous code passes all the tests and validator, I approve your puzzle.
